title: Who won and who lost in Tuesday’s primary elections.
abstract: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York will face Representative Lee Zeldin this fall. Two Trump-endorsed candidates won key primaries in Illinois. Here’s what else happened.

multimedia.caption: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York and Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado at their election night watch party on Tuesday.
Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York and Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado at their election night watch party on Tuesday.
Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York and Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado at their election night watch party on Tuesday.

title: Illinois Governor’s Race Shows G.O.P.’s Lurch to Right (With Nudge From Left)
abstract: Democrats meddled to boost State Senator Darren Bailey in the G.O.P. primary for Illinois governor. But efforts to elevate far-right candidates in Colorado fizzled.

multimedia.caption: State Senator Darren Bailey with his wife Cindy Stortzum, after winning the Republican primary for Illinois governor on Tuesday night.
State Senator Darren Bailey with his wife Cindy Stortzum, after winning the Republican primary for Illinois governor on Tuesday night.
State Senator Darren Bailey with his wife Cindy Stortzum, after winning the Republican primary for Illinois governor on Tuesday night.

title: Tina Peters, an indicted county clerk, loses the G.O.P. primary for Colorado secretary of state to Pam Anderson.
abstract: Ms. Peters, who has become a celebrity in far-right circles, was beaten by Ms. Anderson, a longtime election official who has been a vocal opponent of misinformation about the 2020 contest.

multimedia.caption: Tina Peters is one of several Republican candidates for secretary of state across the country who deny the legitimacy of the 2020 election.
multimedia.copyright: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times

title: Darren Bailey, a far-right state senator, will be the Republican nominee for Illinois governor.
abstract: Mr. Bailey overcame a well-funded rival backed by the state’s Republican leaders with some unusual help: tens of millions of dollars from Gov. J.B. Pritzker, a billionaire Democrat.

multimedia.caption: Darren Bailey accepted an endorsement from former President Donald J. Trump at a rally on Saturday in Mendon, Ill.

title: Trump Aides Watch Testimony and Brace for Damage
abstract: A “stunning two hours” raises fears of political and legal consequences for the former president.
byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

title: The Jan. 6 Committee Produces a Very Special Episode
abstract: At a surprise appearance, a White House aide tells a jaw-dropping story of broken dishes and fragile democracy.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

title: Fetterman 2022: The Steampunk Version of Biden in His Basement
abstract: As he recovers from a stroke, the Democratic Senate nominee in Pennsylvania is running a virtual campaign of online memes and withering mockery of his opponent, Dr. Mehmet Oz.

multimedia.caption: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania on Tuesday near the Monongahela River in Munhall. His campaign is trying to make the most of his recent health crisis, focusing its efforts on virtual campaigning.
multimedia.copyright: Jeff Swensen for The New York Times

title: Cassidy Hutchinson’s Testimony Highlights Legal Risks for Trump
abstract: The former White House aide’s revelations about Jan. 6 chipped away at any potential defense that Donald J. Trump was merely expressing well-founded views about election fraud.
byline: By Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: President Donald J. Trump at the rally outside the White House on Jan. 6, 2021, just before the attack on the Capitol. He was told before going on stage that protestors in the area were armed, an aide testified.
multimedia.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

title: A President Untethered
abstract: In the final, frenzied days of his administration, Donald J. Trump’s behavior turned increasingly volatile as he smashed dishware and lunged at his own Secret Service agent, according to testimony.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: The testimony presented by Donald J. Trump’s former aide, Cassidy Hutchinson, at Tuesday’s House select committee hearing portrayed an unhinged commander in chief veering wildly out of control.
The testimony presented by Donald J. Trump’s former aide, Cassidy Hutchinson, at Tuesday’s House select committee hearing portrayed an unhinged commander in chief veering wildly out of control.
The testimony presented by Donald J. Trump’s former aide, Cassidy Hutchinson, at Tuesday’s House select committee hearing portrayed an unhinged commander in chief veering wildly out of control.

title: Giuliani at Center of Georgia’s Trump Investigation
abstract: Of all the legal threats Rudy Giuliani faces, the criminal inquiry into efforts to reverse the 2020 Georgia election may be the most dire.
byline: By Danny Hakim and Richard Fausset
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: The House committee investigating Jan. 6 showed video of Rudy Giuliani at a December 2020 Georgia hearing, where he peddled false conspiracy theories about the election.
The House committee investigating Jan. 6 showed video of Rudy Giuliani at a December 2020 Georgia hearing, where he peddled false conspiracy theories about the election.

title: Biden’s Health Secretary: ‘No Magic Bullet’ for Preserving Abortion Access
abstract: With the White House under pressure to push back on the Supreme Court’s abortion ruling, the health secretary unveiled steps aimed at preserving access to abortion.
byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Charlie Savage
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

multimedia.caption: Xavier Becerra, the secretary of health and human services, said his department would work with the Justice Department to ensure that women have access to abortion pills.
Xavier Becerra, the secretary of health and human services, said his department would work with the Justice Department to ensure that women have access to abortion pills.

title: Trump Urged Armed Supporters to Capitol, White House Aide Testifies
abstract: Cassidy Hutchinson told the House committee investigating the riot that President Donald J. Trump did not care about the potential for violence because his supporters were not there to attack him.
byline: By Luke Broadwater and Michael S. Schmidt
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: Cassidy Hutchinson, an aide to the White House chief of staff at the time, testified that President Donald J. Trump demanded that his supporters be able to move around freely even though he knew they were armed.

title: As Republicans push back on aid for vaccines, congressional Democrats point fingers over the next steps.
abstract: After a deal was seemingly struck in March, Congress has not agreed on where the money will come from or who will move next.

title: The Man Helping Drive the Investigation Into Trump’s Push to Keep Power
abstract: Thomas Windom, a little-known federal prosecutor, is overseeing key elements of the Justice Department’s intensifying investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election results.
byline: By Glenn Thrush, Alan Feuer and Michael S. Schmidt

title: F.D.A. Advisers Recommend Updated Boosters Targeting Forms of Omicron
abstract: The move came as new federal estimates showed two subvariants made up more than half of new U.S. cases. But it is possible the virus might evolve yet again by the fall.
